title: How to Get Wifi on Your Nintendo DS or Wii

steps.headline: Insert your Nintendo Wi-Fi compatible game into the game slot.
Turn on the system and load the game.
Find the Wi-Fi Settings.
steps.description: Where you go to find them is unique for every game, so you'll have to explore the menus a bit.

steps.headline: Touch "Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection Settings" then touch a blank box that says "none".
Touch "Search for an Access Point".
steps.description: Your DS will now start to look for an access point.

steps.headline: Select your router's SSID.
steps.description: Input your WEP code, if you have one.

steps.headline: Wait.
steps.description: The DS will test your connection settings, which may take a couple moments. Be patient.

steps.headline: Success!
steps.description: You have connected to Nintendo Wi-Fi!

steps.headline: Select the Wii logo in the lower left side of the screen.
steps.description: This will bring you to the Wii options.

steps.headline: Scroll to the second page, and select "Internet".
Pick the appropriate option.
steps.description: If you have a wired connection, then your Wii will test the connection and you're done! If you have a wireless connection, then continue to follow the steps.

steps.headline: Select the appropriate option.
steps.description: If you have a wireless router, select "Search for an Access Point and follow steps 6-8 in the Nintendo DS instructions. If you have a Nintendo Wi-Fi USB Connector or an AOSS compatible access point, follow the simple on-screen instructions.

steps.headline: Success!
steps.description: You have connected to Nintendo Wi-Fi!

text: Nintendo DS Insert your Nintendo Wi-Fi compatible game into the game slot.  Turn on the system and load the game.  Find the Wi-Fi Settings. Where you go to find them is unique for every game, so you'll have to explore the menus a bit. Touch "Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection Settings" then touch a blank box that says "none".  Touch "Search for an Access Point". Your DS will now start to look for an access point. Select your router's SSID. Input your WEP code, if you have one. Wait. The DS will test your connection settings, which may take a couple moments. Be patient. Success! You have connected to Nintendo Wi-Fi! Nintendo Wii Turn on your Wii.  Select the Wii logo in the lower left side of the screen. This will bring you to the Wii options. Select Wii Settings.  Scroll to the second page, and select "Internet".  Select Connection Settings.  Select a box that says "none".  Pick the appropriate option. If you have a wired connection, then your Wii will test the connection and you're done! If you have a wireless connection, then continue to follow the steps. Select the appropriate option. If you have a wireless router, select "Search for an Access Point and follow steps 6-8 in the Nintendo DS instructions. If you have a Nintendo Wi-Fi USB Connector or an AOSS compatible access point, follow the simple on-screen instructions. Success! You have connected to Nintendo Wi-Fi!
